title: ecoevo.social-docs
text:
Rules to respect, etiquette and general things to know about the ecoevo.social server or Mastodon in general.
ecoevo.social is dedicated to the biological Ecology and Evolution community. This is broadly defined so everyone connected to those topics closely or more remotely are welcome.
ecoevo.social is administered by Alexis Simon. This is volunteering work, and as such it may encounter some issues along the road. Please be patient we are all learning here.
If you are in a position to do so, you can contribute financially for the maintenance of the server through Open Collective.
Enjoy connecting!

title: ecoevo.social-docs
text:
About privacy
A safe internet user is an informed internet user.
The privacy policy indicate what will be enforced regarding privacy.






Important considerations about privacy



Posts on Mastodon are not end-to-end encrypted. Do not share any sensitive information over Mastodon. For more details, see the privacy policy.
You must be aware that Mastodon data, both public and direct messages, are accessible by server operators and receiving servers (for example if you send a direct message to someone on another server).
Quoted from the privacy policy: > We may also release your information when we believe release is appropriate to comply > with the law, enforce our site policies, or protect ours or others rights, property, or safety.
If you require to have truly private conversations containing sensitive information with someone else, we suggest you use another application offering end-to-end encryption and privacy.

title: 2  Rules
text:
No racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, or casteism
No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies
No harassment, dogpiling or doxxing of other users
Do not share intentionally false or misleading information
No sexually explicit or violent media posting
No content illegal in France and Germany

This set of rules has been copied from the mastodon.social instance. They are not set in stone and I encorage the community offering changes in wording or adding rules. See the section How to contribute.

title: 3  Etiquette on ecoevo.social
text:
Content Warnings (CW) are useful to 1) protect people sensitive to a given subject from being unwillingly exposed to it, 2) keep subjects that may not interest everyone an opt-in option and/or 3) keep timelines easier to read.
CW should be used for subjects such as:

Trigerring content: such as reports or news about sexual assault, harassment, violence, racism, LGBTQIA+-phobia, burn-out.
Glorification of over-working
Politics
Job postings: you can use the subject area as you would in an email Subject

title: 3  Etiquette on ecoevo.social
text:
3.2 Use of hashtags
Hashtags is how content can be discovered on Mastodon. Text in toots is not searched (in most cases anyway, it requires additional algorithms to do so).
Knowing that, we encourage the use of hashtags to classify more easily the content you share.
Hashtags should use the CamelCase format, where words are separated by upper cases, like so: #ThisNewHashtagIsGreat.
A list of hashtags that could be used on ecoevo.social:

#JobOffer when posting a job offer of any kind, add more hashtags to precise level #TenureTrack, #Postdoc, #GraduateStudent, #Technician, etc. and subjects #Ecology, #Labwork, #Modeling, etc.
#Intership to advertise an internship, precise subjects similar to job offers.
#Conference to advertise a conference.
…

title: 3  Etiquette on ecoevo.social
text:
3.3 Threads
When posting a thread:

Set your first toot to be Public (visible for all)
Answer your first toot and set the visibility to Unlisted (Visible for all, but opted-out of discovery features)
Continue your thread and the visibility will be automatically continued as Unlisted

It is nice to use the i/n indication at the end of your toots to better indicate this is a thread, where i in the current toot and n is the total number of toots (you can keep it as a litteral n if you don’t know the total number of toots). Well you know how to do it if you come from the bird site.

title: 4  How to contribute
text:
This is a quarto book hosted on github.
To contribute, head to the github repository and open either an issue, a pull-request or a discussion.
Documents are written in markdown, and content are in the ./*.qmd documents.

title: 4  How to contribute
text:
4.2 Contributing financially
If you want to contribute financially to server hosting costs, head to Open Collective. The budget is fully transparent there.
We are not there yet, but in case more money than necessary is collected, it will be redistributed to the community. This could take a lot of forms, such as “best student science communication toot” competition and prize?

title: 4  How to contribute
text:
4.3 Helping moderating
If you want to help protect people from this instance against external and internal misbehaviors, you can ask me to help moderating.
Send me direct message @alxsim@ecoevo.social and we can chat.
